alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; South Central Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 06 at 3:59AM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Weather disturbance to bring colder temperatures and light snow showers... Another weather disturbance will bring increasing cloud cover and wind to portions of central and particularly northern Nevada today, with increasing chances for light snow tonight through Thursday. Minimal snow amounts in valleys are expected of less than one half inch at most through Thursday. A stronger weather feature will bring better chances for accumulating snow to valleys across central and northeastern Nevada late Thursday through Friday morning as well as falling temperatures. Snow amounts of one half inch with isolated areas of 2 inches are expected. Probability of greater than 2 inches (greater than 50%) is concentrated around northern Elko county mountains, areas adjacent to the Ruby mountains and along I-80 between Elko and Wells. Since snow is expected overnight, potential for some impacts on roadways increases, particularly by Friday morning. Drier conditions return for Saturday before more light snow arrives to northern Nevada Saturday night into Sunday morning. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
